meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the larvas under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The garden was teeming with larvas after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The larvas decided to have a race to see who could reach the leaf first.
meanings.sent4: The larvas wriggled like tiny dancers on the forest floor.
meanings.sent5: The jar was filled with squirming larvas, a sight that made the children squeal.

meanings.definition: Larvas: a stage in the life cycle of some insects and amphibians, typically resembling a worm
meanings.sent1: Careful observation revealed the larvas transforming into butterflies.
meanings.sent2: The larvas crawled slowly along the damp ground in search of food.
meanings.sent3: The larvas threw a party to celebrate their upcoming metamorphosis.
meanings.sent4: The larvas in the pond seemed to dance in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The farmer marveled at the larvas' ability to change into completely different creatures.
